segment.source: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security (Windows 10)
segment.target: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security (Windows 10)

segment.source: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security
segment.target: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security

segment.source: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security
segment.target: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: This is an overview of the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security (WFAS) and Internet Protocol security (IPsec) features.
segment.target: This is an overview of the Windows Firewall with Advanced Security (WFAS) and Internet Protocol security (IPsec) features.

segment.source: Feature description
segment.target: Feature description

segment.source: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security is an important part of a layered security model.
segment.target: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security is an important part of a layered security model.

segment.source: By providing host-based, two-way network traffic filtering for a device, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security blocks unauthorized network traffic flowing into or out of the local device.
segment.target: By providing host-based, two-way network traffic filtering for a device, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security blocks unauthorized network traffic flowing into or out of the local device.

segment.source: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security also works with Network Awareness so that it can apply security settings appropriate to the types of networks to which the device is connected.
segment.target: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security also works with Network Awareness so that it can apply security settings appropriate to the types of networks to which the device is connected.

segment.source: Windows Firewall and Internet Protocol Security (IPsec) configuration settings are integrated into a single Microsoft Management Console (MMC) named Windows Firewall with Advanced Security, so Windows Firewall is also an important part of your network’s isolation strategy.
segment.target: Windows Firewall and Internet Protocol Security (IPsec) configuration settings are integrated into a single Microsoft Management Console (MMC) named Windows Firewall with Advanced Security, so Windows Firewall is also an important part of your network’s isolation strategy.

segment.source: Practical applications
segment.target: Practical applications

segment.source: To help address your organizational network security challenges, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security offers the following benefits:
segment.target: To help address your organizational network security challenges, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security offers the following benefits:

segment.source: Reduces the risk of network security threats.
segment.target: Reduces the risk of network security threats.

segment.source: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security reduces the attack surface of a device, providing an additional layer to the defense-in-depth model.
segment.target: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security reduces the attack surface of a device, providing an additional layer to the defense-in-depth model.

segment.source: Reducing the attack surface of a device increases manageability and decreases the likelihood of a successful attack.
segment.target: Reducing the attack surface of a device increases manageability and decreases the likelihood of a successful attack.

segment.source: Safeguards sensitive data and intellectual property.
segment.target: Safeguards sensitive data and intellectual property.

segment.source: With its integration with IPsec, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security provides a simple way to enforce authenticated, end-to-end network communications.
segment.target: With its integration with IPsec, Windows Firewall with Advanced Security provides a simple way to enforce authenticated, end-to-end network communications.

segment.source: It provides scalable, tiered access to trusted network resources, helping to enforce integrity of the data, and optionally helping to protect the confidentiality of the data.
segment.target: It provides scalable, tiered access to trusted network resources, helping to enforce integrity of the data, and optionally helping to protect the confidentiality of the data.

segment.source: Extends the value of existing investments.
segment.target: Extends the value of existing investments.

segment.source: Because Windows Firewall with Advanced Security is a host-based firewall that is included with the operating system, there is no additional hardware or software required.
segment.target: Because Windows Firewall with Advanced Security is a host-based firewall that is included with the operating system, there is no additional hardware or software required.

segment.source: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security is also designed to complement existing non-Microsoft network security solutions through a documented application programming interface (API).
segment.target: Windows Firewall with Advanced Security is also designed to complement existing non-Microsoft network security solutions through a documented application programming interface (API).

segment.source: In this section
segment.target: In this section

segment.source: Topic
segment.target: Topic

segment.source: Description
segment.target: Description

segment.source: Isolating Windows Store Apps on Your Network
segment.target: Isolating Windows Store Apps on Your Network

segment.source: You can customize your Windows Firewall configuration to isolate the network access of Windows Store apps that run on devices.
segment.target: You can customize your Windows Firewall configuration to isolate the network access of Windows Store apps that run on devices.

segment.source: Securing End-to-End IPsec Connections by Using IKEv2 in Windows Server 2012
segment.target: Securing End-to-End IPsec Connections by Using IKEv2 in Windows Server 2012

segment.source: You can use IKEv2 to help secure your end-to-end IPSec connections.
segment.target: You can use IKEv2 to help secure your end-to-end IPSec connections.

segment.target: Learn more about using Windows PowerShell to manage the Windows Firewall.
